result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rachel A Belanger

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rachel A Belanger in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM155
10:41 case is called and appearances stated on the record.
15CM128, 15CM248 and 155
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
  
Cases 15CM128 and 15CM248 - DRI
Defendant will plea to 15CM155
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Plea waiver is filed.
The victims in 15CM155 is only case with victim rights and victim were notified.  No victim present from WalMart.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights.  Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
NC plea is entered to all 3 counts in 15CM155.  

Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently made of her plea of No Contest

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
 Defendant makes no statement to the court.

The court states the recommendations are appropriate and its the court hope that defendant is able to comple the sentence without any issues.  

BY THE COURT:
Withhold sentencing on all 3 counts
Period of probation of 24 months on each count and concurrent to each other
No restitution
Conditions:
--Obtain an alchol and other drug assessment and comply with all treatment deemed necessary after been assessed
--Maintain absolute sobriety during period of supervision
--Do not possess or consume and prescribed substance
--Provide releases to your agent to have access to medical records and medications
--No associate with people who you know or have reason believe that are consuming controlled substances illegally
--No contact with WalMart in Plover, Wisconsin.
--Counseling and treatment deemed necessary by agent
--Pay the costs associated with the court


No fine.  
11:04 case is adjourned.

10:35 a.m. Attorney Ryan Drengler in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not present as she is in jail for a positive reading at Day Report. Matter rescheduled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 10:00 am.

10:07 a.m. Defendant Rachel A Belanger not in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Drengler present. State requests a body only warrant.  Atty Drengler request a cash alternative. BTC: Bench Warrant - Body only
10:15 a.m. Court recalls case as Defendant has now appeared. Cases 15CM155, 15CM128, 15CM248 warrants are quashed. ADA Constable requests an adjournment and asks the Court to order the Defendant to go today and provide a UA sample as according to her bond.
BTC: Matter rescheduled and Defendant to immediately return to Jail to provide a UA sample according to her bond conditions.
$1,000 sig bond: Comply with all conditions of pending cases.

Defendant Rachel A Belanger in court with attorney(Ann Renc for Ryan Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.

BTC: $1,000 sig bond: Comply with all conditions of pending cases.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 09:15 am.
